Name: Breccia vase
Description: In 1990, a patron offered to the Museum of Brussels a beautiful vase in breccia that was part of 142 pieces of crockery which he had acquired a little earlier. It is thought that the whole collection comes from one or various tombs of the same site in the region of the Red Sea. Probably dating from the beginning of the Old Kingdom, the container, which was very well preserved, served to hold ointments and cosmetic oils.
